rocks.bastion.core.model

Class StringResponseDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • rocks.bastion.core.model.StringResponseDecoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseDecoder

    public class StringResponseDecoder
extends Object
implements ResponseDecoder
    A ResponseDecoder which will take the HTTP response content-body and put it in to a String. This should be the last decoder which gets executed in the decoder chain. If none of the other decoders Bastion execute could decode the HTTP response body, then this final decoder will just take the content body data and initialise a string using it. This ensures that all Bastion tests contain some sort of model object decoded from the response.

    • Constructor Detail

        public StringResponseDecoder()

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public Optional<?> decode(Response response,
                          DecodingHints hints)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseDecoder
        Attempts to decode the given HTTP response to a Java object. If this decoder is unable to decode the HTTP response, then it should return an empty Optional. Otherwise, it should return an Optional container containing the decoded object.

        A user might have supplied a target object type it wants the decoded information bound to. In this case, the target model type to bind to will be given in the hints parameter, accessible using the DecodingHints.getModelType() method.

        Specified by:
        decode in interface ResponseDecoder
        Parameters:
        response - The HTTP response for the converter to decode
        hints - Additional hints which can be used for decoding the provided response
        Returns:
        An empty Optional if this converter cannot decode the HTTP response. An Optional containing the decoded object, otherwise.
